intro.description: Once opened, the contents of your data file is presented in the editor area. The editors opened allow you to examine your data. The editor area can hold many opened files which can be switched between using the tabs at the top of the area. Each editor's presentation of a file's content will differ according to the type of data file format.

item.title: Images
item.description: Image file formats will be shown in a table with a row per image and columns containing an image name (possibly defaulting to "image-01", etc), maximum and minimum pixel values and the storage class of each pixel value.

item.title: ASCII-based Text Files
item.description: Certain column-based ASCII files are also shown in the same way: each column in the file is represented by a row in a table.

item.title: HDF5/NeXus Files
item.description: HDF5 and NeXus files are displayed as hierarchical trees where branches are indicated by right-pointing triangles. Clicking on the triangles expand the tree and show further branches.
